title: Anaiah
html: ANAIAH(A·naiʹah) [Jah Has Answered].1. One of the men who stood at Ezra’s right hand when he read the Law to the people, on the first day of the seventh month. Probably a priest or prince.—Ne 8:2, 4.2. One of the headmen of the people whose descendant, if not he himself, attested to the confession contract of Nehemiah.—Ne 10:1, 22.
